DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Fatigue Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the degree of distress they experience related to their fatigue, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms._A question about whether an individual feels or felt fatigued._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt fatigued.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt fatigued.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Fatigue Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (I seldom feel tired or fatigued) to 5 (Most of the time, I feel exhausted) on a Likert scale used on the Symptom Distress Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Most of the time, I feel exhausted

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Most of the time, I feel exhausted
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt exhausted most of the time.

Concepts.longName: Feel Exhausted Most of the Time
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels or felt exhausted most of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I am usually very tired and fatigued

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I am usually very tired and fatigued
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was usually very tired and fatigued.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was usually very tired and fatigued.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: There are periods when I am quite tired and fatigued

ValueMeaning.preferredName: There are periods when I am quite tired and fatigued
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had periods when they were quite tired and fatigued.

Concepts.longName: Have Periods When Quite Tired or Fatigued
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had periods when they were quite tired and fatigued.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: There are periods when I am rather tired or fatigued

ValueMeaning.preferredName: There are periods when I am rather tired or fatigued
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had periods when they were rather tired or fatigued.

Concepts.longName: Have Periods When Rather Tired or Fatigued
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had periods when they were rather tired or fatigued.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I seldom feel tired or fatigued

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I seldom feel tired or fatigued
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual seldom feels or felt tired or fatigued.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual seldom feels or felt tired or fatigued.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SDS User's Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development, method of administration,  scoring procedures and psychometric properties of the SDS.
